text:
*[Bug 18982] Ctrl-C does not clear the command being typed at the prompt on Windows*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18982>

--- Comment #2 from Thomas Soeiro (<mailto:Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr|Thomas.SOEIRO@ap-hm.fr>) ---
In response to comment 1

> I believe I understand in principle what the issue is, but I would not have time to work on it anytime soon, and I doubt anyone else in R-core currently does either.

Would you have any chance to expand a little on that and/or provide some
guidance on how to address it? From previous bug reports and the commit
history, I guess we need to change `src/gnuwin32/getline/getline.c`.

> If you want to see this resolved, you or someone else with a strong interest will have to provide a patch that we can review and possibly adopt.

Unfortunately, I'm afraid it's way beyond my capabilities since it likely
involves C. So I hope I'm not the only one with a strong interest! :)

elements.text: [Bug 18982] Ctrl-C does not clear the command being typed at the prompt on Windows
I believe I understand in principle what the issue is, but I would not have time to work on it anytime soon, and I doubt anyone else in R-core currently does either.

Would you have any chance to expand a little on that and/or provide some
guidance on how to address it? From previous bug reports and the commit
history, I guess we need to change
If you want to see this resolved, you or someone else with a strong interest will have to provide a patch that we can review and possibly adopt.

Unfortunately, I'm afraid it's way beyond my capabilities since it likely
involves C. So I hope I'm not the only one with a strong interest! :)

text:
*[Bug 18979] method for implicit generic 'norm' (x="ANY", type="missing") does not dispatch*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18979>

Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CONFIRMED
     Ever confirmed|0                           |1
                 CC|                            |maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch

--- Comment #1 from Martin Maechler (<mailto:maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch|maechler@stat.math.ethz.ch>) ---
Thank you, Mikael, for unearthing why this had not worked as planned, *and* how
to fix it efficiently.
It's a bit unfortunate of course to use an undocumented hidden object in
{`methods`}.  OTOH, this *is* in `methods` and the parts where that
`.implicitTable` is being created. ... so even though it looks a bit ugly,
your fix is efficient and seems ok, notably as I could not see how to do this
similarly efficiently and code-compactly ...

I will need a bit more "poking around" .. and may not get to committing your
patch before Christmas.. but plan to do that before the end of the month in any
case.
